name: py-jax

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
JAX is Autograd and XLA, brought together for high-performance machine
learning research. With its updated version of Autograd, JAX can
automatically differentiate native Python and NumPy functions. It can
differentiate through loops, branches, recursion, and closures, and it
can take derivatives of derivatives of derivatives. It supports reverse-
mode differentiation (a.k.a. backpropagation) via grad as well as
forward-mode differentiation, and the two can be composed arbitrarily to
any order.

dependencies.name: py-absl-py
dependencies.description:
This repository is a collection of Python library code for building
Python applications. The code is collected from Google's own Python code
base, and has been extensively tested and used in production.

dependencies.name: py-etils
dependencies.description: etils (eclectic utils) is an open-source collection of utils for python.

dependencies.name: py-ml-dtypes
dependencies.description:
A stand-alone implementation of several NumPy dtype extensions used in
machine learning libraries.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-opt-einsum
dependencies.description: Optimized Einsum: A tensor contraction order optimizer.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-scipy
dependencies.description: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-typing-extensions
dependencies.description:
The typing_extensions module contains both backports of these changes as
well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).

dependent_to.name: py-chex
dependent_to.description: Chex is a library of utilities for helping to write reliable JAX code.

dependent_to.name: py-earth2mip
dependent_to.description:
Earth-2 Model Intercomparison Project (MIP). A python framework that
enables climate researchers and scientists to explore and experiment
with AI models for weather and climate.

dependent_to.name: py-tensorflow-probability
dependent_to.description:
TensorFlow Probability (TFP) is a Python library built on TensorFlow
that makes it easy to combine probabilistic models and deep learning on
modern hardware (TPU, GPU). It's for data scientists, statisticians, ML
researchers, and practitioners who want to encode domain knowledge to
understand data and make predictions.

dependent_to.name: py-neuralgcm
dependent_to.description: NeuralGCM: Hybrid ML + Physics model of Earth's atmosphere.

dependent_to.name: py-alphafold
dependent_to.description:
AlphaFold is an AI system developed by DeepMind that predicts a
protein's 3D structure from its amino acid sequence. It regularly
achieves accuracy competitive with experiment.

dependent_to.name: py-optax
dependent_to.description: A gradient processing and optimisation library in JAX.

dependent_to.name: py-graphcast
dependent_to.description: GraphCast: Learning skillful medium-range global weather forecasting.

dependent_to.name: py-tensorflow
dependent_to.description: TensorFlow is an open source machine learning framework for everyone.

dependent_to.name: py-jmp
dependent_to.description: JMP is a Mixed Precision library for JAX.

dependent_to.name: py-dinosaur
dependent_to.description: Dinosaur: differentiable dynamics for global atmospheric modeling.

dependent_to.name: py-orbax-checkpoint
dependent_to.description:
Orbax includes a checkpointing library oriented towards JAX users,
supporting a variety of different features required by different
frameworks, including asynchronous checkpointing various types, and
various storage formats. We aim to provide a highly customizable and
composable API which maximizes flexibility for diverse use cases.

dependent_to.name: py-jraph
dependent_to.description: Jraph: A library for Graph Neural Networks in Jax.

dependent_to.name: py-flax
dependent_to.description: Flax: A neural network library for JAX designed for flexibility.

dependent_to.name: py-mpi4jax
dependent_to.description:
Zero-copy MPI communication of JAX arrays, for turbo-charged HPC
applications in Python.

dependent_to.name: py-keras
dependent_to.description:
Multi-backend Keras. Keras 3 is a new multi-backend implementation of
the Keras API, with support for TensorFlow, JAX, and PyTorch.
